name: prth
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3
body: |- wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(wa(w0, w2), wa(w1, w3)))

stmt.origin: anim12d(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), w0, w2, w1, w3)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(wa(w0, w2), wa(w1, w3)))
-| wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(w0, w1))
-| wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(w2, w3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(wa(w0, w2), wa(w1, w3)))
-| wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(w0, w1))
-| wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(w2, w3))

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(w0, w1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(wa(w0, w2), wa(w1, w3)))
-| wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(w2, w3))

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(w2, w3))

cumulated.origin: |- wi(wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(w2, w3)), wi(wa(w0, w2), wa(w1, w3)))

comment: Conjoin antecedents and consequents of two premises. This is the closed theorem form of ~ anim12d . Theorem *3.47 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 113. It was proved by Leibniz, and it evidently pleased him enough to call it _praeclarum theorema_ (splendid theorem). (Contributed by NM, 12-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 7-Apr-2013.)
